thread.title: Forget Harry’s Cafe De Wheels it seems international pop stars today prefer a bit of chook
thread.title_full: Forget Harry’s Cafe De Wheels it seems international pop stars today prefer a bit of chook | DailyTelegraph

author: Jonathon Moran
title: Forget Harry’s Cafe De Wheels it seems international pop stars today prefer a bit of chook
text:
IT used to be Harry’s Cafe De Wheels but it seems Nandos is the new must visit fast food joint for international celebrities when they come to Australia.
Justin Bieber had a Melbourne eatery shut down so he could grab a feed when he was on a promo tour last month and Jason Derulo says a stop at Nandos is a priority on his tour in a few weeks.
“I’ll definitely be partying after every show, that’s a given,” he said.
“I’ve got to hit the beach and go to Nandos. You always want what you can’t have right and we don’t have that (Nandos).”
Derulo, 26, will kick off his national tour at Sydney’s Allphones Arena before playing shows in Melbourne and Brisbane.
Derulo is not the only one with a love of Nandos with Justin Bieber having this Melbourne Nandos Chicken in South Melbourne shut down so he could grab a feed. Picture: David Crosling He’ll be supported by T.I., Pia Mia and Austin Mahone in a bill that reads more like a mini pop music festival than a standard concert.
Other Stories Awesome All Blacks lay Cardiff ghosts to rest Rugby 0 comments Will Geoffrey ever find love again? Sydney Confidential 0 comments Former NRL star ‘dragged woman down stairs’ Nsw Falconio killer ‘more like a prison guard’ Nsw What would PM’s tax return really show? Opinion 0 comments Robert Irwin’s animal instinct Celebrity “You’ll have a whole show before the show,” he said.
“It is so many different worlds colliding. My set will be about an hour and a half and it will be like a roller coaster ride from the top of the show because we go pretty crazy.”
Derulo is one of the biggest male pop stars of today.
He’s sold millions of albums worldwide with hits including It Girl, In My Head, Talk Dirty, Want To Want Me and Wiggle.
Pop Singer Pia Mia forms a part of Derulo’s support performers. Source: YouTube And while Ariana Grande and Rita Ora have recently talked about the double standards of males vs. females in the pop industry, Derulo claims men have it as tough as women.
“We are constantly compared every single day,” he said. “It is always a competition in other people’s minds. They constantly compare me to other artists, that just comes with the territory. I think it is just an industry thing. I don’t think it is gender specific.”
Derulo recently made headlines in the US when police were called to his California home when he had a house party. He was issued a fine for excessive noise.
“It was a little too much,” he said of the police response. “About 50 came, there were helicopters, it was like Project X.”
Jason Derulo performing shirtless at Nova'sRedRoom Global Tour 2:28 Singing sensation Jason Derulo performs with his shirt off at Nova'sRedRoom Global Tour in Sydney's Marquee.
July 31st 2015 3 months ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/
